channel.title: golang on Haruaki TAMADA
channel.description: Recent content in golang on Haruaki TAMADA

item.title: uniq2
item.description: ğŸ—£ Overview uniq2 deletes duplicated lines. GNU core utilities have uniq command for deleting duplicate lines. However, uniq command deletes only continuous duplicate lines. When deleting not continuous duplicate lines, we use sort command together, in that case, the order of the list was not kept. We want to delete not continuous duplicated lines with remaining the order. ğŸ³ Docker tamada/uniq2 (https://hub.docker.com/r/tamada/uniq2) 1.1.1, latest 1.0.2 ğŸº Install $ brew tap tamada/brew # <- the first time only.

item.title: heatman
item.description: ğŸ—£ Overview Create heat map image from given csv file. Go language implementation of tamada/heatman. ğŸº Install $ brew tap tamada/brew # <- the first time only. $ brew install heatman ğŸ³ Docker tamada/heatman (https://hub.docker.com/r/tamada/heatman) 1.0.1, latest ğŸŒ Web pages Project page on GitHub https://github.com/tamada/goheatman Web page https://tamada.github.com/heatman ğŸ“œ License WTFPL WTFPL permits ğŸ‘ Commercial use, ğŸ‘ Modification, ğŸ‘ Distribution, and ğŸ‘ Private use.

item.title: lioss
item.description: ğŸ—£ Overview License identifying tool for OSS projects. This tool has license database, and analyzes given license by $k$-gram, word frequencies, or tfidf algorithm. ğŸº Install $ brew tap tamada/brew # <- the first time only. $ brew install lioss ğŸ³ Docker tamada/lioss (https://hub.docker.com/r/tamada/lioss) 0.9.0, latest $ docker run -it --rm -v $PWD:/home/lioss tamada/lioss:latest [OPTIONS] [ARGUMENTS...] ğŸŒ Web pages Project page on GitHub https://github.

item.title: tjdoe
rrh
item.description: ğŸ—£ Overview rrh is a simple git repository manager. There are too many repositories. We love programming; however, to manage many repositories is quite hard and bothersome tasks. Therefore, we built a headquarter for managing the git repositories, named rrh. rrh manages repositories by categorizing in groups and execute git command to the groups. I know the tool ghq, manages the git repositories. However, I cannot use it for the following reasons.
